title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.76 - Method; proof
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.76 - Method; proof

State Regulations

Charges, petitions, orders and other process and papers
of the board, its members, agent or agency, may be served electronically, personally, by regular mail, by registered mail, by commercial mail service, or
by leaving a copy at the principal office or place of business of the person to
be served. A declaration or affidavit of service, setting forth the manner of
such service, the return post office receipt when registered and mailed as
aforesaid, or electronic confirmation shall constitute proof of service. Final
orders issued by the board shall be served upon the parties by registered or
certified mail, or pursuant to section
263.15
of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
263.76

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
